back_cards.definition_en: Used before a vowel sound to mean one
back_cards.example_en: She ate an apple for lunch.

back_cards.definition_en: A determiner in a daily context
back_cards.example_en: He saw an elephant at the zoo.

back_cards.definition_en: An article in a descriptive context
back_cards.example_en: An old book was on the table.

back_cards.definition_en: A word in a school context
back_cards.example_en: The teacher explained an important rule.

back_cards.definition_en: A term in a narrative context
back_cards.example_en: An adventure began in the forest.

back_cards.definition_en: A title used before a man’s surname
back_cards.example_en: Mr. Smith taught the math class.

back_cards.definition_en: A form of address in a formal context
back_cards.example_en: She wrote a letter to Mr. Johnson.

back_cards.definition_en: A title in a professional context
back_cards.example_en: Mr. Lee was the company director.

back_cards.definition_en: A term in a social context
back_cards.example_en: Mr. Brown helped organize the event.

back_cards.definition_en: A title in a school context
back_cards.example_en: The students respected Mr. Davis.

back_cards.definition_en: People or things different from those mentioned
back_cards.example_en: Some left, but others stayed.

back_cards.definition_en: A term in a social context
back_cards.example_en: She shared her food with others.

back_cards.definition_en: A reference in a daily context
back_cards.example_en: He bought gifts for others.

back_cards.definition_en: A group in a community context
back_cards.example_en: Others volunteered at the shelter.

back_cards.definition_en: A term in a school context
back_cards.example_en: Others in the class finished early.

back_cards.definition_en: Extremely frightened
back_cards.example_en: She was terrified of the dark.

back_cards.definition_en: A feeling in a social context
back_cards.example_en: He was terrified before his speech.

back_cards.definition_en: A state in a narrative context
back_cards.example_en: The character was terrified in the storm.

back_cards.definition_en: An emotion in a daily context
back_cards.example_en: The dog was terrified of thunder.

back_cards.definition_en: A reaction in a school context
back_cards.example_en: She was terrified of failing the test.

back_cards.definition_en: Causing great fear
back_cards.example_en: The horror movie was terrifying.

back_cards.definition_en: A quality in a narrative context
back_cards.example_en: The storm was a terrifying sight.

back_cards.definition_en: An experience in a social context
back_cards.example_en: Her story was terrifying to hear.

back_cards.definition_en: A feature in a natural context
back_cards.example_en: The terrifying roar echoed in the forest.

back_cards.definition_en: A moment in a daily context
back_cards.example_en: The loud crash was terrifying.

back_cards.definition_en: A stretch of land and its features
back_cards.example_en: The terrain was rocky and steep.

back_cards.definition_en: A feature in a natural context
back_cards.example_en: They hiked over rugged terrain.

back_cards.definition_en: A subject in a geography lesson
back_cards.example_en: The class studied desert terrain.

back_cards.definition_en: A setting in a recreational context
back_cards.example_en: The terrain challenged the bikers.

back_cards.definition_en: A landscape in a military context
back_cards.example_en: The soldiers navigated the terrain.

back_cards.definition_en: A flat outdoor area by a building
back_cards.example_en: They dined on the terrace.

back_cards.definition_en: A feature in a household context
back_cards.example_en: The terrace had a view of the garden.

back_cards.definition_en: A structure in a community context
back_cards.example_en: The terrace was decorated for the party.

back_cards.definition_en: A level in a landscape context
back_cards.example_en: The hillside was shaped into terraces.

back_cards.definition_en: A setting in a social context
back_cards.example_en: The café’s terrace was always busy.

back_cards.definition_en: The period of holding a position
back_cards.example_en: Her tenure as mayor was successful.

back_cards.definition_en: A term in a professional context
back_cards.example_en: His tenure at the company lasted ten years.

back_cards.definition_en: A status in an academic context
back_cards.example_en: The professor earned tenure.

back_cards.definition_en: A duration in a work context
back_cards.example_en: Her tenure brought many changes.

back_cards.definition_en: A period in a historical context
back_cards.example_en: His tenure as leader was brief.

back_cards.definition_en: Not certain or fixed; hesitant
back_cards.example_en: She made a tentative plan for the trip.

back_cards.definition_en: A quality in a professional context
back_cards.example_en: His tentative proposal needed work.

back_cards.definition_en: A state in a social context
back_cards.example_en: Her tentative smile showed nervousness.

back_cards.definition_en: An approach in a daily context
back_cards.example_en: He took tentative steps on the ice.

back_cards.definition_en: A plan in a school context
back_cards.example_en: The tentative schedule was posted.

back_cards.definition_en: Nervous or afraid
back_cards.example_en: She felt tense before the exam.

back_cards.definition_en: A mood in a social context
back_cards.example_en: The room was tense during the debate.

back_cards.definition_en: A state in a narrative context
back_cards.example_en: The story’s tense moment kept her reading.

back_cards.definition_en: A feeling in a daily context
back_cards.example_en: He was tense after the argument.

back_cards.definition_en: A situation in a work context
back_cards.example_en: The meeting was tense due to conflicts.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who rents property
back_cards.example_en: The tenant paid rent on time.

back_cards.definition_en: A role in a housing context
back_cards.example_en: The tenant reported a leaky faucet.

back_cards.definition_en: A person in a legal context
back_cards.example_en: The tenant signed a new lease.

back_cards.definition_en: An occupant in a community context
back_cards.example_en: The tenant joined the building’s events.

back_cards.definition_en: A renter in a business context
back_cards.example_en: The tenant ran a shop in the mall.

back_cards.definition_en: A desire to do something unwise
back_cards.example_en: The temptation to eat cake was strong.

back_cards.definition_en: An urge in a daily context
back_cards.example_en: He resisted the temptation to skip work.

back_cards.definition_en: A lure in a social context
back_cards.example_en: The temptation of a sale drew her in.

back_cards.definition_en: A desire in a narrative context
back_cards.example_en: The story explored temptation and choice.

back_cards.definition_en: An attraction in a cultural context
back_cards.example_en: The temptation of fame was hard to ignore.

back_cards.definition_en: To entice someone to do something
back_cards.example_en: The dessert tempted her after dinner.

back_cards.definition_en: To attract in a daily context
back_cards.example_en: The warm bed tempted him to stay.

back_cards.definition_en: To lure in a social context
back_cards.example_en: The offer tempted her to switch jobs.

back_cards.definition_en: To entice in a narrative context
back_cards.example_en: The treasure tempted the explorer.

back_cards.definition_en: To persuade in a marketing context
back_cards.example_en: The sale tempted shoppers to buy.

back_cards.definition_en: A person’s state of mind or anger
back_cards.example_en: He lost his temper during the argument.

back_cards.definition_en: A mood in a social context
back_cards.example_en: Her calm temper soothed the group.

back_cards.definition_en: A trait in a personal context
back_cards.example_en: His temper made him hard to approach.

back_cards.definition_en: A behavior in a daily context
back_cards.example_en: She kept her temper in check.

back_cards.definition_en: A quality in a narrative context
back_cards.example_en: The character’s temper caused trouble.

back_cards.definition_en: A structure at the end of a chromosome
back_cards.example_en: The scientist studied telomere length.

back_cards.definition_en: A term in a biology lesson
back_cards.example_en: The class learned about telomeres and aging.

back_cards.definition_en: A focus in a medical context
back_cards.example_en: Telomeres were linked to cell health.

back_cards.definition_en: A subject in a research context
back_cards.example_en: Her research focused on telomere repair.

back_cards.definition_en: A concept in a scientific context
back_cards.example_en: Telomeres protect DNA during division.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who works at a bank counter
back_cards.example_en: The teller processed her deposit.

back_cards.definition_en: A role in a financial context
back_cards.example_en: He spoke to the teller about his account.

back_cards.definition_en: A narrator in a storytelling context
back_cards.example_en: The teller shared a folk tale.

back_cards.definition_en: A worker in a professional context
back_cards.example_en: The teller was friendly and helpful.

back_cards.definition_en: A person in a community context
back_cards.example_en: The teller knew all the regular customers.

back_cards.definition_en: Communication over a distance using technology
back_cards.example_en: Telecommunication improved global business.

back_cards.definition_en: A field in a professional context
back_cards.example_en: She studied telecommunication in college.

back_cards.definition_en: A system in a technical context
back_cards.example_en: The telecommunication network was upgraded.

back_cards.definition_en: A tool in a daily context
back_cards.example_en: Telecommunication kept them connected.

back_cards.definition_en: An industry in a business context
back_cards.example_en: The telecommunication sector grew rapidly.

back_cards.definition_en: Boring and tiring due to length or dullness
back_cards.example_en: The tedious task took hours.

back_cards.definition_en: A quality in a work context
back_cards.example_en: Data entry was tedious but necessary.

back_cards.definition_en: A feeling in a daily context
back_cards.example_en: The long wait was tedious.

back_cards.definition_en: A state in a school context
back_cards.example_en: The tedious lecture bored the students.

back_cards.definition_en: A process in a narrative context
back_cards.example_en: The journey was tedious and slow.

back_cards.definition_en: Full of or causing tears
back_cards.example_en: Her tearful goodbye moved everyone.

back_cards.definition_en: A mood in a social context
back_cards.example_en: The tearful reunion was emotional.

back_cards.definition_en: A state in a narrative context
back_cards.example_en: The character’s tearful moment was heartfelt.

back_cards.definition_en: An emotion in a daily context
back_cards.example_en: She was tearful after the sad news.

back_cards.definition_en: A reaction in a cultural context
back_cards.example_en: The tearful speech honored the heroes.

back_cards.definition_en: The ideas or principles taught by someone
back_cards.example_en: The teachings of the philosopher inspired her.

back_cards.definition_en: A concept in a school context
back_cards.example_en: The class studied the teachings of history.

back_cards.definition_en: A doctrine in a religious context
back_cards.example_en: The teachings guided their faith.

back_cards.definition_en: A lesson in a cultural context
back_cards.example_en: The elder shared teachings with the youth.

back_cards.definition_en: A principle in a personal context
back_cards.example_en: His teachings shaped her values.
